intro: Stigmaphyllon merrillii, commonly known as the yellow stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
